task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, then transport and place it onto the red plate, finally retreating to a safe pose.

task_long_description.overview: A 6-DoF robotic arm with a parallel gripper operates on a tabletop containing a red plate and a white plate. The robot must first perceive the white plate, approach it from above, align precisely, compute a grasp, and pick it up. It then transfers the grasped plate toward the red plate, aligns above the red plate, lowers until contact, releases the plate, and retreats to a safe height. Visual confirmation and contact cues guide the placement while avoiding collisions and slippage.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the red and white plates
Camera/vision pipeline running and extrinsics valid
stepwise_plan: Perceive/confirm white plate; scan if not visible
Open gripper and move above white plate
Fine align and compute a top grasp; pick the plate
Perceive/confirm red plate; move above it
Align, lower until contact, and open gripper to release
success_criteria: White plate placed stably centered on the red plate
Robot ends in a collision-free safe pose
failure_and_recovery: White plate not detected → scan in spiral pattern
Misalignment during placement → re-approach and lower again
Unexpected contact → retreat and retry approach
task_long_description.termination: Task ends after successful release on the red plate and final retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool center point aligned close to white plate rim; imminent grasp indicated.
frame_3.predicts_next: Successful grasp and lift, followed by transfer toward red plate.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Checks if the white plate is visible.
Active search for the white plate if not initially visible.
Open gripper to the widest preset before approach.
Move to a pregrasp pose above the white plate.
Refine alignment for a precise top grasp.
Compute grasp pose and store on blackboard.
Execute grasp using the computed pose.
Back off to a safe height/pose after pick.
Checks if the red plate is visible.
Search for red plate if not visible.
Move to pre-place pose above red plate.
Align for placement over red plate.
Lower the plate until contact with the red plate surface.
Retreat to a safe final pose.

recovery_strategy: Fallback to spiral scan when target not visible
Re-approach and recompute grasp, then retry pick
Retreat on unexpected contact and re-align
assumptions: The white circular object in frames is treated as the white plate; the red circular object is the red plate.
End frames suggest successful release; exact centering on the red plate is inferred.

expected_success_criteria: OpenGripper after contact leaves plate stable
